meanings.definition: The quality or state of being selfish.
meanings.sent1: Her constant selfishnesses made it hard for others to enjoy spending time with her.
meanings.sent2: His selfishnesses were evident when he refused to share his toys with his siblings.
meanings.sent3: Despite his selfishnesses, he still managed to have a few close friends who understood him.
meanings.sent4: The selfishnesses of the greedy businessman knew no bounds.
meanings.sent5: The selfishnesses of the character in the story served as a cautionary tale for children.

meanings.sent1: The selfishnesses of the child were evident when he refused to let others play with his toys.
meanings.sent2: She displayed her selfishnesses by always putting her needs above those of others.
meanings.sent3: His selfishnesses at the party were comical as he hoarded all the snacks for himself.
meanings.sent4: The selfishnesses of the dictator led to the suffering of his people.
meanings.sent5: The selfishnesses of the character in the movie made the audience dislike him intensely.
